summary: This is an email from attorney Jeanne M. Christensen to Leon Black and Douglas Wigdor, forwarding an attachment related to a conversation that occurred on the morning of March 4, 2024. The email is marked as external and contains confidentiality warnings.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Author of the email, identifies herself as a partner at Wigdor LLP and is forwarding an attachment related to a conversation involving Doug.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email from Jeanne M. Christensen.

persons.name: Douglas Wigdor
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email from Jeanne M. Christensen, and the law firm is named after him.

persons.name: Doug
persons.context: Mentioned as having had a conversation with the sender on the morning of March 4, 2024, which is the subject of the attached document.

connections.description: Christensen is a partner at Wigdor LLP, the law firm named after Douglas Wigdor, indicating a colleague or employer-employee relationship.
Christensen is communicating directly with Leon Black via email, likely in a legal or advisory capacity.
Christensen references a conversation she had with Doug on the morning of March 4, 2024, the details of which are in the attachment.
Both are recipients of the same email from Christensen, suggesting they are both involved in the same matter.

events.title: Morning Conversation with Doug
events.description: A conversation occurred between Jeanne M. Christensen and an individual named Doug, the details of which are contained in an attachment forwarded to Leon Black and Douglas Wigdor.

events.title: Email Forwarding Attachment
events.description: Jeanne M. Christensen sends an email to Leon Black and Douglas Wigdor forwarding an attachment related to the earlier conversation with Doug.

keyFacts: The document is an email from attorney Jeanne M. Christensen to Leon Black and Douglas Wigdor dated March 4, 2024.
The email forwards an attachment concerning a conversation between Christensen and an individual named Doug that occurred that morning.
The communication is marked as external and contains strong confidentiality and attorney-client privilege warnings.
The law firm involved is Wigdor LLP, where Christensen is a partner.
